image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives, Gift of the U.S. Association of Former Members of Congress

profileText: A Representative from Kansas; born in Good Intent, Atchison County, Kans., August 4, 1948; attended public schools in Atchison, Kans.; attended the Netherlands School of International Business and Economics, 1969; B.S., Washburn University, Topeka, Kans., 1970; J.D., Washburn University Law School, Topeka, 1974; Kansas Army National Guard; realtor; admitted to the Kansas bar, 1975 and commenced practice in Topeka; elected to the Kansas house of representatives, 1972-1978; elected as a Democrat to the Ninety-eighth and to the five succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1983-January 3, 1995); was not a candidate for reelection in 1994, but was an unsuccessful candidate for election for Governor of Kansas.

researchRecord.name: 1983-1994, 89 cubic feet.
researchRecord.description: The collection of James Slattery contains congressional papers and correspondence, photographs and portraits. Also included are oversight reports; hearings testimony; voting record; bills; floor statements; speeches; invitations accepted; patronage, case and subject files; 98th Congress New Members Class listings and Democratic Caucus files; Budget Committee election, target, form and other letters; constituent and legislative correspondence; weekly columns; press releases; mailings; schedules; summer intern files; guest books; mail administration records; district information; newspaper clippings; and photographs of the congressman and his predecessors. Restricted.

recordLocation.name: Manuscript Collections, Library and Archives Division

researchRecord.name: 1988-1994, 2 commercials on 1 videoreel.
researchRecord.description: The commercials were used during James Slattery's campaigns for the 1988 U.S. congressional election in District 2 and the 1994 gubernatorial election in Kansas, Democratic Party.

recordLocation.name: The Julian P. Kanter Political Commercial Archive, Department of Communication
